title: Ukraine showed the UK its classic 'tactically safe' trench-clearing methods don't work in chaotic, booby-trapped trenches
description: The UK had thought of trenches as "pretty clean and sort of surgical," an officer said. But in Ukraine, they are chaotic and full of traps.

title: 'Deep indignation' after Ukraine diver switches to Russia
description: The Ukrainian Diving Federation wants diver Sofiia Lyskun to be stripped of all awards after the European champion switched her international allegiance to Russia.

title: Oil prices hold gains amid stalled Ukraine peace talks, US rate cut hopes
Russia mocks EU deliberations on frozen assets, says seizure will prompt 'harshest response'
description: Russia said on Thursday that any "illegal action" by the European Union in relation to ​its frozen assets would elicit "the harshest reaction", and that ‌Moscow was already preparing its response.  The European Commission proposed on Wednesday an ‌unprecedented use of frozen Russian assets or international borrowing to raise 90 billion euros ($105 billion) for Ukraine to cover its struggling military and basic services against Russia's war.  The proposal would invoke emergency ⁠powers in order to ‌circumvent any veto from EU countries that are friendly towards Russia, such as Hungary and Slovakia.

title: Exclusive drone footage shows devastated Ukrainian town almost encircled by Russian forces
description: Exclusive drone footage obtained by The Associated Press on Wednesday shows a devastated Ukrainian town nearly encircled by Russian forces near the city that Moscow this week claimed to now control.  Barely a street appears to be untouched in Myrnohrad in Ukraine’s eastern Donetsk region, 12 kilometers (7 miles) from the key logistics hub of Pokrovsk.  “They are trying to simply erase the (town) from the face of the earth,” said Oleksii Hodzenko, press officer of the drone battalion of the 38th Marine Brigade, whose soldiers were still fighting inside Myrnohrad on Wednesday.

title: Oil prices hold declines amid Ukraine peace talks
US sees progress after talks in Florida with Ukraine, but more work needed to reach deal
Sea drones halt operations at major Russian oil terminal
description: One of Russia's largest oil terminals halted operations on Saturday following an attack by sea drones, hours before Ukrainian negotiators were headed to the United States for talks on ending the war.The Caspian Pipeline Consortium (CPC), a group that includes US oil majors Chevron and ExxonMobil and which owns the terminal, called the strike a "terrorist attack".Ukraine, which did not comment on the incident, has sought to punch back against its neighbour as the war grinds through its fourth year.The attack came as Moscow's forces fired a deadly storm of drones and missiles at Ukraine, killing three people and damaging buildings across Kyiv, according to Ukrainian officials."As a result of a targeted terrorist attack by unmanned boats at 4:06 am Moscow time (0106 GMT) single Mooring Point 2 (SMP-2) sustained significant damage," the CPC said in a statement on Telegram.

title: Vast Russian overnight attack on Ukraine kills six, wounds dozens
Late drama in Scotland's DNA after Ukraine draw
description: Scotland head coach Melissa Andreatta says her team "never stop" after their last-gasp equalier against Ukraine.

title: ‘A step-change’: tech firms battle for undersea dominance with submarine drones
description:
As navies seek to counter submarines and protect cables, startups and big defence companies fight to lead market
Flying drones used during the Ukraine war have changed land battle tactics for ever. Now the same thing appears to be happening under the sea.
Navies around the world are racing to add autonomous submarines. The UK’s Royal Navy is planning a fleet of underwater uncrewed vehicles (UUVs) which will, for the first time, take a leading role in tracking submarines and protecting undersea cables and pipelines. Australia has committed to spending $1.

title: Brent little changed as investors zoom in on Russia-Ukraine talks, OPEC+
Oil in Worst Monthly Run Since 2023 With OPEC+, Ukraine in Focus
description: Oil headed for the longest run of monthly losses in more than two years, as traders looked ahead to an OPEC+ meeting this weekend and gauged US-led efforts to end the conflict in Ukraine.

title: Oil Declines With Focus on Ukraine Peace Talks and OPEC+ Meeting
description: Oil fell as investors tracked US-led efforts to end the war in Ukraine, while looking ahead to an OPEC+ gathering this weekend.

title: ‘Embarrassing’: Republican lawmaker blasts Trump’s Ukraine peace plan
description: As President Trump touts his peace plan in Ukraine, GOP Rep. Don Bacon is speaking out against it –saying the plan amounts to Ukraine surrendering to Russia.

title: Trump's Ukraine plan triggers outrage from Republican lawmakers
description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -Several congressional Republicans are harshly criticizing President Donald Trump's White House over its handling of a proposed Ukraine peace plan they say favors Russia, a sharp departure for a party that has adhered closely to almost all ​of Trump's initiatives. Backers of Ukraine have worried that a U.

title: Witkoff advised Russia on how to pitch Ukraine plan to Trump
description: U.S. presidential envoy Steve Witkoff held a phone call last month with a senior Kremlin official to suggest they work together on a plan for Ukraine.

title: Trump says no firm deadline for Ukraine, Russia to reach peace deal
Oil Holds Near Month-Low as Trump Hails Progress on Ukraine Deal
description: Oil steadied after closing at a one-month low on signs a Ukrainian peace deal is getting closer, a development that could herald the removal of curbs on Russian crude just as a global glut looms.

title: What to Watch in Commodities as US Pushes Ukraine Peace Deal
description: Fresh efforts to end the war in Ukraine are putting renewed scrutiny on what will happen to the flow of multiple raw materials that have been upended by the near-four-year conflict.

title: Boris Kagarlitsky on the Trump Administration’s 28-Point Plan to End the Ukraine War
description: Boris...

title: Russia's new jet-powered strikes are testing Ukraine, but few of these weapons are actually in play, officials say
description: Senior Ukrainian officials told Business Insider that Russia is using new jet-powered drones and bombs, but not in large numbers.

title: Ukraine's special ops forces say they just scored a battlefield first: taking out a Russian helicopter with a 'deep strike' drone
description: Both Russia and Ukraine need their helicopters, but they are vulnerable. Ukraine has been able to take some out with aerial and naval drones.

title: McAneny called up by Scotland women for first time
description: Celtic midfielder Maria McAneny has been called up by Scotland women for the first time for the friendly matches with Ukraine and China.

title: Oil Holds Ground as Traders Look to Risk-On Mood, Ukraine Talks
description: Oil steadied as investors tracked risk-on mood in wider financial markets, which countered the impact of progress in peace talks over Ukraine that could pave the way for increased crude supplies.

title: Daughter of ex-South African leader Zuma is accused of luring men to fight in Russia-Ukraine war
description: South African police say they are investigating allegations that former President Jacob Zuma 's daughter Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla lured 17 men who are now trapped in Russia into fighting in that country's war with Ukraine without their consent.  According to police spokesperson Athlenda Mathe, an affidavit filed by Zuma-Sambudla's sister Nkosazana Bonganini Zuma-Mncube alleges that Zuma-Sambudla and two other people lured the men by claiming they would receive security training in Russia.

title: Ukraine's special ops forces say they just scored a battlefield first: taking out a Russian helicopter with a 'deep strike' drone
description: Both Russia and Ukraine need their helicopters, but they are vulnerable. Ukraine has been able to take some out with aerial and naval drones.

title: Secret U.S.-Russia talks led to plan that blindsided Ukraine
description: Witkoff and Dmitriev forged the plan during an October meeting in Miami that included Jared Kushner, Trump’s son-in-law, who worked with Witkoff on the Israel-Gaza peace deal.

title: Oil falls as Ukraine peace talks edge toward a solution
US, Ukraine to continue work on 'refined' peace plan to end war with Russia
Oil Extends Slump as Traders Assess Outlook for Deal on Ukraine
description: Oil dropped after posting the biggest weekly loss since early October, as traders weighed the prospect of a Ukraine-Russia peace deal that could increase crude flows into an already well-supplied market.

title: Ukraine and Russia both to cede plenty in proposed U.S. peace plan
description: STORY: Here are the key points from the U.S. drafted peace plan for ending the war in Ukraine The plan locks in Russia's battlefield gains since February 2022, almost one-fifth of Ukraine.Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy has previously ruled out gifting Moscow any territory.Ukraine would also to have to cede the rest of Donetsk to Russia - an area it currently controls.

title: Republican and Democratic senators alike oppose Trump’s Ukraine peace plan that acquiesces to many Russian demands
description: The plan was crafted by the Trump administration and the Kremlin without Ukraine’s involvement.

title: Rubio says the Ukraine peace proposal was authored by the US
US, Ukraine and European officials hold talks in Geneva on Trump's plan to end war
Ukraine's president is under growing pressure. Here are 5 things to know
description: The president of Ukraine is facing a confluence of crises testing his ability to lead an increasingly weary nation nearly four years into a devastating full-scale invasion by Russia.  For more than a week, Volodymyr Zelenskyy has struggled to contain the fallout from a $100 million corruption scandal implicating top officials and other associates.  The pressure on Zelenskyy has ratcheted up as the United States pushes a proposal it drew up with Russia that would require major concessions from Ukraine — and seemingly few from Russia — to bring an end to the war.

title: Putin cautiously welcomes U.S. peace plan as Trump issues challenge to Zelenskyy
description: A U.S. peace proposal seen as favoring Russia stipulates Ukraine to hand over some territory to Putin.

title: Russian troops seen patrolling streets in Ukraine’s Pokrovsk
description: STORY: :: Given as Pokrovsk, Ukraine:: Released November 20, 2025:: Russian Defense Ministry:: Russian defense ministry footage is said to show its soldiers patroling the streets of Ukraine's Pokrovsk:: Ukrainian maps show the area as a gray zone, but Russian maps now show the city to be under its control :: Reuters was able to confirm the location of parts of the video shot in south Pokrovsk from local landmarks Reuters was able to confirm the location of parts of the video shot in south Pokrovsk from buildings, signs, roads and trees which matched satellite and file imagery. The location in other parts of the video could not be verified.The date on which the video was filmed could also not be verified.Russia has been threatening Pokrovsk for more than a year, using a pincer movement to attempt to encircle it and threaten supply lines.Moscow says taking Pokrovsk, dubbed "the gateway to Donetsk" by Russian media, would give it a platform to drive north towards the two biggest remaining Ukrainian-controlled cities in the Donetsk region - Kramatorsk and Sloviansk.

title: Western soldiers are turning to Xbox controllers to fight a new kind of drone war. The pilots love them.
description: Operators are using the Xbox controllers to fly interceptor drones, an air defense tool that has been used extensively in Ukraine.

title: European Gas Hits 18-Month Low as Ukraine Digests Peace Plan
description: European natural gas traded at the lowest levels in 18 months as Ukraine and its allies work through a peace plan brokered by the US and Russia that could have far-reaching repercussions for global energy markets.

title: Ukraine firmly rejects any border changes under US peace plan
description: Ukraine's ambassador to the United States has firmly ruled out any border changes in the country in response to a US peace plan to end the war launched by Russia nearly four years ago. "The territorial integrity of Ukraine and the changing of Ukrainian borders is not something which should be put on the table," Olha Stefanishyna said during a roundtable discussion in Washington on Thursday evening.
